page.title: 17Local Industry
page.content: The only industry in our area is {Richard Lees.} They manufacture pre-stressed{concrete beams,}to the extent of 25,000 square metres per week, worth Â£280,000. All the land that Richard Lees is now on used to be fields. They employ 242 people, 128 in the factory, 102 in the offices, and 12 on building sites. 120 employees live locally. They get to work in a works bus or their own cars. The goods go to the London area and all over England and Wales. The beams are transported by lorries. The raw materials they use are sand and limestone, all coming from local quarries. Thay also have cement which comes from Rugby. The raw materials are stored behind the factory in hoppers, which are big bins. The firm has no lorries, but hires some from local companies. There are no guard
